metadata.synopsis: Dialog between survivors gathered around a dead hag spy, Jatlo. Happens when the hag is killed before players have triggered combat with the spy.Mayrina and Mask of Regret are optional speakers.
metadata.how_to_trigger: In CTY_Main_A - first debug destroy |Circle of Pearls| - S_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagResurrectionCircle 3f00a318-4728-443f-a987-d1dfcad588e6 - (-2328; 10; -97)- then debug kill the hag- Teleport to Jatlo - S_LOW_HagSurvivors_HagSpy - 0cb0a73b-1f97-4481-b320-b8fff88cfe0f - (-53 11 -160)

7.speaker: Kled
7.text: Is it dead? Please tell Kled that it's dead.

53.speaker: Mayrina
53.text: That's a dead redcap, all right - ugly bastards.

35.speaker: Adrielle
35.text: It killed itself with no hesitation. Why would it do such a thing?

40.speaker: Mayrina
40.text: It was crying - saying Ethel was dying.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: I killed her - she's not coming back.

46.speaker: Mayrina
46.text: Well, I'll bloody be. Should've known if anyone was going to save the day, it'd be you.
46.context: NodeContext: delighted to see the player

37.speaker: Mayrina
37.text: Gang - meet the hero who rescued me and my little one from Auntie Ethel - and was then kind enough to finish the job.

9.speaker: Adrielle
9.text: This is the one who dared the depths of a hag lair? It is a pleasure - Mayrina has spoken of you often.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: Mayrina - what are you doing here?

54.speaker: Mayrina
54.text: You hardly expected me to just sit on my backside after you saved me, hm?

51.speaker: Mayrina
51.text: Don't be shy, gang - they're one of the good ones.

31.speaker: Mayrina
31.text: We prefer the term 'survivors', thank you very much.

20.speaker: Mayrina
20.text: I came to the city, looking for people like me who'd fallen victim to the hag. Sadly, I found plenty.

45.speaker: Mayrina
45.text: We were researching hags when Auntie Ethel's redcap found us. Cheers for taking care of the witch - only sad I couldn't see it.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: I didn't do this for you.

55.speaker: Mayrina
55.text: Still crabby, I see. Well, you have my gratitude regardless. Thanks - from me and the little one.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: You've grown up a lot since we last met.

10.speaker: Mayrina
10.text: Hah! That's a nice way of saying I'm not such a brat - but I appreciate it.

47.speaker: Mayrina
47.text: With Ethel gone, maybe I'll finally sleep in peace. Thanks - from me and the little one.

48.speaker: Mayrina
48.text: The gang said they'd seen you. Glad you made sure Ethel got what's coming.
48.context: NodeContext: delighted to see the player

28.speaker: Player
28.text: I was happy to kill Ethel.

29.speaker: Mayrina
29.text: Good. I'm only sad I couldn't see it myself.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: Glad to see you in human form again. How was life as a sheep?

8.speaker: Mayrina
8.text: Urgh. My mouth tastes like mutton - and everything is so itchy.
8.context: NodeContext: a shudder (talking about being turned into a sheep)

17.speaker: Mayrina
17.text: Thankfully with Ethel gone, no one else will know what it's like to shit pellets.
17.context: NodeContext: making a joke of her situation

24.speaker: Mayrina
24.text: Here - a little thank you for killing Ethel, from me and the little one.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: I didn't do it for you.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: Can confirm - that is a dead redcap.

33.speaker: Adrielle
33.text: Indeed - it killed itself with no hesitation. But why?

0.speaker: Kled
0.text: Kled heard it cry. It said 'Auntie Ethel' - and that she was dying.

50.speaker: Adrielle
50.text: Could it be? Is our tormentor gone? Is Ethel finally dead?

49.speaker: Player
49.text: I killed her - and she's not coming back.

34.speaker: Adrielle
34.text: By Helm, thank you. We'd been researching hags, and made the mistake of drawing Auntie Ethel's ire.

6.speaker: Adrielle
6.text: Were it not for you, this redcap would have been the end of us. Here - a token for your bravery, though it is but small against such a monumental deed.

13.speaker: Kled
13.text: *Sniff.* You smell weird - like death and, and hag magic!

27.speaker: Adrielle
27.text: Curious. Few who tangle with a hag survive - as we know too well. We're victims of a hag's cruelty and formed this group to research our tormentors.

14.speaker: Adrielle
14.text: But we drew the ire of Auntie Ethel and she sent this redcap, among other evils, to kill us. Is it true, then? Is the witch dead?

12.speaker: Player
12.text: Yes - I'm glad you're all safe.

32.speaker: Adrielle
32.text: As am I - it will be a pleasure to sleep with both eyes shut.

22.speaker: Adrielle
22.text: As if I would let you leave with empty pockets.

5.speaker: Adrielle
5.text: Here - a token for your bravery, though it is but small against such a monumental deed.

52.speaker: Adrielle
52.text: Dealing with a hag can leave one a touch paranoid - I do not blame you for keeping secrets. Nevertheless, thank you.
